key_channel_insights.line_content: 90% of itineraries on OTAs are priced the same as Aer Lingus' website, showcasing high consistency.
In 74.96% of cases, MSE channels offer lower prices compared to Aer Lingus' website, highlighting a strong competitive pricing position.
Nearly 98% of prices on GDS are higher than the airline's website, indicating a dominant trend of premium pricing in this channel.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 90% of itineraries in OTA channel are priced the same as Aer Lingus' website consistently across time periods.
OTAs frequently price higher, with approximately 10% of itineraries showing higher prices than Aer Lingus' site.
The OTA channel shows nominally lower prices for less than 1% of itineraries, maintaining a consistent and slight reduction trend.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 90% of OTA itineraries align with Aer Lingus' website on average.
Around 10% of OTA fares are higher than direct site pricing, with minor fluctuation.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 89% of short-haul fares are identical to website pricing, indicating strong alignment in this segment.
16% of long-haul fares are higher on OTAs, showing a notable premium compared to website pricing.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: IE-based Origin itineraries have almost complete price parity with the website at 97%.
Non-IE origins show more higher pricing, at about 16% against the direct site, but presence of lower pricing remains below 1%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: SAME pricing for close-in bookings reaches 90%, exhibiting major parity with Aer Lingus direct sales.
Far-out bookings depict higher OTA pricing at approximately 13%, while SAME pricing covers majority at 86%.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel has a high frequency of offering lower prices than the airline's website, with 74.96% of cases in the latest week.
Prices matching between website and MSE channel remain stable with a gradual increase from the previous week to the latest week, showing a 7.25% rise.
Instances where the MSE channel prices were higher than the airline's website were minimal, at just 0.61% in the latest week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No instances of website offers being unavailable on MSE were reported.
Matched prices between MSE and airline website increased by 7.25% from the previous week.
There is a notable increase in MSE offering lower prices, rising 7.48% from the previous week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: The MSE channel more frequently offers lower prices for short-haul flights, representing 74.18% of cases in the latest week.
The long-haul segment saw an increase in MSE offering higher prices from 0% previously to 0.64% in the latest week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For itineraries originating in Ireland, 74.69% had lower prices on the MSE channel as of the latest week.
Non-Ireland origins showed a 14.26% increase in price matching between MSE and Aer Lingusâ€™ site over the latest week.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings saw a high prevalence of lower prices on MSE, accounting for 77.78% in the latest week.
Far-out bookings maintain consistency with significant lower pricing on MSE, capturing 69.37% in the most recent analysis.

gds_highlights.line_content: Roughly 98% of prices on GDS are higher compared to the airline's website, consistently observed.
Instances where GDS offered lower prices than the airline's site are nearly negligible across all dimensions.
Overall, the pricing status across dimensions shows consistency over the weeks and months.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Between 97.8% and 99.1% of cases indicate GDS prices are higher compared to the airline's website.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul flights nearly always show GDS prices higher than the website, averaging a 1.55% difference.
Long haul routes exhibit slightly less price discrepancy, with GDS higher in roughly 90% of cases and a narrow 0.18% average difference.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: Consistent Higher Pricing for IE Origins
gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from IE show 98.9% of GDS fares higher than the airline's website, with a 2.78% average price difference.
Non-IE regions also exhibit higher GDS pricing 97.8% of the time, albeit with a lesser average difference of 0.35%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, GDS fares are higher 98.07% of the time with a 1.23% average price discrepancy.
Far-out bookings show slightly more volatility with a 1.75% average price discrepancy, though 99.07% remain higher.
